titleStmt.title: William B. Thompson et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4215

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Shepherdsville Ky Sept 10 1863
To his Excellency Thos E. Bramlett

the undersigned would respectfully state that Hilary Jackson & George Jackson were fined eighteen dollars each before R. A. Wise a justice of the peace for this county, the difficulty occurred at the election they are very poor boys, and the sons of a poor widow who is dependent upon their labour for a support and unable to pay it. We respectfully ask your excellency to remit the fine.
Sept 10 1863

Wm B Thompson
R. J. Megler
Westly Phelp
C. R. Samuels
Nat. P. Saunders
E. C. McCormick
John O Brian
W. C. Barbour
Dr. A.. D.. Coffey
Michael Troutman
B F Troutman
H Simmons
Charles Lee
Robert Brashear
Sam Ahlock
Ken. Chaplze
W A Rouse
Jesse Griffin
Lloyd Friddle
What is the date of the Judgement for Send copy of Judgement or abstract
Sent letter on 12th Sept for copy judgement
